item.title: About Us
item.description:
About Us

What we do: A workforce intermediate apprenticeship program into television industries.

item.title: Apprenticeship Program
item.description:
Apprenticeship Program

DEN’s Apprenticeship is designed as a two-year program. A minimum of 2400 hours of on-the-job work training and 360 hours of classroom training is required over the course of two years in order to become a journeyworker. Apprentices start at 60 percent of the journeyworker's rate and progress to 70, 80, 90 and 100 percent as they fulfill specific work and training requirements. Benefits are established using the same guidelines as for journeyworkers.

item.title: Classes
item.description:
Classes

Training

At our locations or yours!We look forward to the opportunity to train your members at your facility or jobsite. Please contact Keith Vitale, Training Director, at 630-653-0006 ext. 251 to discuss and arrange training.

item.title: Union Benefits
item.description:
Union Benefits

A Union Laborer has many advantages over his non-union counterpart. First and foremost, a Union Laborer is part of an organization whose goal is to provide good wages, benefits and safe working conditions for all of its members. The Laborers International Union of North America (LIUNA) strives to maintain that goal each and every day.
